page.title: 16The George Billington Lock.
page.content: We all walked down to the river and saw the lock. The lock is necessary because there is a weir.Mr. Hutchings works for the Upper Avon Navigation Trust and he told us all about the lock, the old mill and the tower. After Mr.Hutchings had explained everything we shut both gates and let some water in .When the water had stopped coming in we opened one gate and in came a boat.When the lock was full we opened the other gate and the boat floated through.We looked at the navigation tower.The tower is used for giving instructions.After we had looked at the navigation tower we saw the old mill.There used to be water round the old mill because it used to help grind the flour.The lock is named after George Billington who died aged thirty two from cancer.It is a lovely place to visit.
